I am not one to write negative reviews but I just didn't see the point of this film. I love unconventional, experimental cinema but this to me was just basically two not very attractive people having sex. Personally, I think I could have produced, directed and acted better than anything here, and I've never produced, directed or acted in anything ever.

I saw this film at a festival and am surprised to see so many negative reviews here.  It seems that the reviewers did not read the description before buying.  They are criticizing the film for not being what they mistakenly thought it was.  This is hardly the film makers' fault.  Would you give a romantic comedy a bad review because the action sequences were missing?

This film is not a formulaic, plastic, fake LA porn film, and the description doesn't say that it offers that. It tries to capture something missing from porn: the actors' desire to actually be on set and actually have sex with their partner.

For my taste it could have moved a tiny bit faster but but that might just be me.  On the day I'd watched quite a few films and, as you can see by my comments I'm pretty impatient.  But after a day of the same old dead-eyed, over-made-up, men's-heads-out-of-shot rubbish this film was a breath of fresh air!

No plot , little dialog , just two people imatateing rabbits  and they don't even look like they're haveing fun. Definitely low budget.

Sex is so often misrepresented: in porn it's often focused on the genitals and in Hollywood it's either negatively depicted (see "The Accused") or censored so the scene fades to black before we see anything. Skin Like Sun seeks to counter this: this a real couple having sex in real time. I think it does a good job of capturing the intimacy and small moments that happen in real-life sex. Someone was complaining about "too many head shots" but I'm not sure what they expected (or why they just didn't seek out standard porn). I think the focus on interaction and smiling and pleasure is great.

If you want an erotic film that's a little bit different to the mainstream (and yes, female friendly), I think you'll like this film.
This DVD has some eroticism. That is good.

Save your money. The best part of this very slow moving French soft-core porno is the cover on the box. Much of the footage consists of long shots of the young girl's face. Ditto her work in a day-care center. She tries it with a man, she tries it with a woman, she likes going down on a woman. That's the plot. I gave it away. There's nothing else to it. Wanna see some action? Not much here.
